what was that command again?: Looks fine to me.  It's set to mode 755 which means everyone can read it.
Go view your apache logs then.
Your index.html file is readable by apache right?  (ex: chmod 644 index.html)
Well, they need to be readable if you want apache to serve them.
thanks for pointing me in the right direction. :) seems i need to learn a lot about permisions first.
Sorry I stepped away...  Did you get it figured out?
do, "sudo chmod 644 /var/www/*" and that will make all files within  /var/www readable.

If apache still can't serve up any content from your /var/www dir, then it's time to view your /var/log/apache/error.log for clues.  Apache's config files have many options and maybe something is not configured properly.
Only if you changed the config file(s).  But it can't hurt to reload it (/etc/init.d/apache reload).
Did apache's error log give you any clues?
You're going to be most interested in the last few lines of the error log.  Anyway, good luck with it.  I'm sure you'll get it figured out.
